conversations.content: Wings of Black: Part One
I will never forget that day I came to know righteousness.
Offer up your Desires to our Monarch!
Strange people came to town and everyone began acting oddly—yet I could do nothing.

I was nothing but a child—and a coward. I wasn't strong the way the prince and his friends who always helped the village were. I could barely manage to hold my breath as I trembled in my hiding place.
＂Hmm?! Someone's there!＂
I heard the strange people coming toward me and knew this would be my end.
And then, a shadowy black figure came running and a voice shouted, ＂Come, Arsène!＂ A moment later, something appeared like a fire sparking in the darkness.
It was a person clad in what looked like a mask and wrapped in great black wings—or perhaps it was no person at all.
The strange people's bodies began to swell and pop, and soon ferocious creatures with terrible fangs and claws burst forth and surrounded the pair.
I was afraid. SO afraid. I should have looked away, yet my eyes were transfixed by the pair who dared confront them.
Far from being afraid, the man smiled boldly, leapt into the air, and shot at the creatures.
＂You're mine!＂ he cried.
I was absolutely captivated by that strength.
Wings of Black: Part Two
Despite the threat to all of the people I loved and held dear, I couldn't do anything but cower and tremble.
I was a weak little child, not some bold prince. So many excuses for inaction filled my mind that I didn't even bother to stand.
But then, I saw a man in a black overcoat along with a black-winged figure, and felt something catch fire deep inside me.
In that moment, I was done with excuses. Instead, I wanted to be like them.
What had flared up within me was the courage to stand and face my fears.
Something in my mind told me that so long as I had the will, I could fly anywhere.
That was ten years ago, and I still haven't forgotten.
＂You protected the village again, Papa!＂ cried my son after my latest adventure. ＂I wanna be just like you when I grow up!＂
As I listen to my son speak, I remember those black wings.
The righteousness I came to know that day burns inside me still, and I know it will continue to do so long into the future.
